txt.en: 'We made it out....'

The magnificent horse looks ready to bear the Thane's family to the end of the world and back. It must have sensed its master's need, for it is prepared to carry its precious riders to safety at once.
Instance: War Comes to Rohan

'Do not look at me that way, [placeholder]; you need not pity me. My husband is strong and stubborn, and does his duty with pride.

'Yes, I would rather have him safe by my side, but that is not the way of the Rohirrim.

'Come, we must make towards the stables. Utred wants us to take his war-steed to Harwick....'
'They are upon us! Go, [placeholder], with Dala -- we will be fine. We will leave immediately. They come from the north, and we make for the south.\n\n'Be safe, [placeholder]!'
Thane Utred refuses to abandon his city

'These \qNazgûl\q of Mordor cannot be so strong as to lay low a strong city such as Langhold, full of hale Rohirrim warriors and war-steeds. I will not let the brigands refute their exile while I live!\n\n'The women and children are to leave, but the Men of Langhold will stand and defend the city.'
The Thane convinces his children to go willingly with Cíllan
'Thank heavens they left willingly, the brave dears. I must collect myself before I go out and rally the men.\n\n'Please... will you go see them off safely, [placeholder]? I need a moment to myself.'
Thane Utred needs a moment alone to collect his thoughts
Thane Utred of Langhold has a decision to make.\n\nYou should speak with the Thane of Langhold.
'My poor city! What now, [placeholder]? My Thane is dead, and my city burns....\n\n'We survivors must make for Harwick. I can only hope Harding has room for us.'
The war-steed is prepared for the evacuation
Help fight for Langhold
Thane Utred is in the Mead Hall of Langhold.\n\nYou should listen to the Thane's conversation with his family, and then follow them outside when they are finished speaking.
The sounds of battle ring in the north of town...
Find Dala in the chaos and follow him
Thane Utred is in the Mead Hall of Langhold.\n\nYou should listen to the Thane's conversation with his family, and then follow them outside when they are finished speaking.
The evacuees are safe; you should run to the defence of Langhold
Follow Dala
Thane Utred is in the Mead Hall of Langhold.\n\nYou should listen to the Thane's conversation with his family, and then follow them outside when they are finished speaking.
The battle is near!
Cíllan is on the steps of the Mead Hall.\n\nYou should speak with Cíllan.
The Thane has fallen, and madness comes over all
You should find Utred's war-steed by following Cíllan and her children.
Run after Dala to escape
You should watch the evacuating women and children, and ensure that they get a safe start on the road.
You should watch the evacuating women and children, and ensure that they get a safe start on the road.
Invading brigands are at the north gate of Langhold.\n\nYou should hurry to the north gate and fight back the brigands.
Hear Thane Utred's decision on the fate of Langhold
Observe the Thane's conversation with his family
See if Utred is all right
Leave the Mead Hall and search for Cíllan outside
Talk to Cíllan outside the Mead Hall
Ready Utred's war-steed for carrying the Thane's family to safety
Make sure the innocent denizens of Langhold get a safe start to Harwick
Talk to Cíllan
Hurry to meet the invaders in battle
Observe the battle for Langhold.
In the chaos of Langhold's fall, Dala calls your name.
Follow Dala.
Langhold is on the brink of a worrisome attack by unified forces of vengeful brigands and blood-thirsty Easterlings, backed by Mordor.
'[placeholder], we must run! The Thane is dead, and Langold burns as we speak. Run, run!'
